references.paper_title: A survey of NL2SQL with large language models: Where are we, and where we are going?
references.reason: This survey paper provides a broad overview of the current landscape of NL2SQL research with large language models, making it highly relevant for situating the present work.

references.paper_title: Spider: A large-scale human-labeled dataset for complex and cross-domain semantic parsing and text-to-sql task
references.reason: As the paper introducing the Spider dataset, which is used as a benchmark in the current paper, it is a crucial reference for evaluating the proposed model.

references.paper_title: Codes: Towards building open-source language models for text-to-sql
references.reason: Because they explored an approach for open NL2SQL resources, this work likely informs the model architecture or training strategies used in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Can llm already serve as a database interface? a big bench for large-scale database grounded text-to-sqls
references.reason: This explores capabilities of large models in this area, which is core to the new work and represents important experiments.

references.paper_title: Omnisql: Synthesizing high-quality text-to-sql data at scale
references.reason: Since OmniSQL is used to generate high-quality text to SQL data, this reference is crucial for the discussion of data engineering and the use of synthetic data to improve the NL2SQL task.
